sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The works of the famous Nicholas Machiavel, citizen and secretary of Florence written originally in Italian, and from thence newly and faithfully translated into English. Works. English. 1680 Machiavelli, Niccolò, 1469-1527. Neville, Henry, 1620-1694.
[41], 189 [i.e. 179] p., [5], 199-267 [i.e. 265] p., [5], 267-431 [i.e. 429] p., [5], 433-528 p.
Printed for John Starkey, Charles Harper, and John Amery ..., London : 1680.
"The history of Florence," "The prince," "The discourses," and "The art of war" each has special t.p. Translated by Henry Neville. Cf. NUC pre-1956. Nicholas Machiavel's letter is in vindication of himself and his writings. Reproduction of original in University of Michigan Libraries.
=======

[41], 189 [i.e. 179] p., [5], 199-267 [i.e. 265] p., [5], 267-431 [i.e. 429] p., [5], 433-528 p.
Printed for John Starkey, Charles Harper, and John Amery ..., London : 1680.
"The history of Florence," "The prince," "The discourses," and "The art of war" each has special t.p. Translated by Henry Neville. Cf. NUC pre-1956. Nicholas Machiavel's letter is in vindication of himself and his writings. Reproduction of original in University of Michigan Libraries.
